items.title: Amazon will ship this 48- by 28-inch electric standing desk to your doorstep for $80 (Reg. $150)
items.summary:
Marsail 48- by 28-inch Electric Standing Desk

Buy for $80 (Reg. $150)

What we love

If your desk has seen better days or if you’re just starting to build out your office, this is a solid price point to cash in on for a standing desk. Generally speaking a 48-inch surface is a common width for an entry-level standing desk, but where this desk differs is in its depth, which spans 28 inches. That tacks on an addition 4 inches which can be helpful if you want to use a larger display and not be right up against it.

items.title: Why California’s new AI safety law succeeded where SB 1047 failed
items.summary: California just made history as the first state to require AI safety transparency from the biggest labs in the industry. Governor Newsom signed SB 53 into law this week, mandating that AI giants like OpenAI and Anthropic disclose, and stick to, their safety protocols. Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Lab launches its first product, Tinker, an API for fine-tuning language models, in private beta with support for Qwen and Llama  —  Thinking Machines Lab, led by a group of prominent former OpenAI researchers, is betting that fine tuning cutting-edge models will be the next frontier in AI.

items.title: Add four Edison bulbs with Matter support to your smart home while they’re just $7.50 a pop
items.summary:
Linkind Matter Edison Bulbs (4-pack)

Buy for $30 (Reg. $38)

What we love

These days, any smart bulbs I pick up have Matter support. Most of our readers know by now that this is a simple way of saying that something works with all of the major smart home ecosystems like Apple, Google, Alexa, Samsung, and more. These bulbs fit the bill, and won’t break the bank either at just $7.50 each. Given the fact that they offer up Edison styling, this is a solid price point worth cashing in on.

items.title: Best Buy is clearing out SteelSeries’ Arctis Pro Wireless headset today with 50% off at $140 low
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Best Buy that gets you the SteelSeries Arctis Pro wireless headset in black for $139.99 shipped. That’s a full 50% off its $280 listed price, and the lowest we’ve seen for this model. It was going for nearly $200 on Amazon before selling out, which makes Best Buy’s offer particularly appealing today. This deal is now matching the all-time low the headset briefly hit earlier this year in April, giving you another shot if you missed out before. Head below for more details.
